text: Jacqueline Alduy (20 March 192415 March 2016) was a French politician. She was the mayor of Amélie-les-Bains-Palalda for 42 years, from 1959 to March 2001. She was the mother of Jean-Paul Alduy, mayor of Perpignan, and the wife of Paul Alduy, who was also mayor of Perpignan from 1959 to 1993. == Roles in the Senate == * Senator for Pyrénées-Orientales (19821983) * Member of the commission for cultural affairs == Earlier roles == * General Council of Pyrénées-Orientales (19672001) * Mayor of Amélie-les-Bains from 1959 to 2001 == External links == * Her webpage on the Senate website == References == Category:1924 births Category:2016 deaths Category:20th-century French women politicians Category:21st-century French women politicians Category:French Senators of the Fifth Republic Category:Women members of the Senate (France) Category:Mayors of places in Occitanie Category:People from Hanoi Category:People from Pyrénées-Orientales Category:People of French Indochina Category:Politicians of the French Fifth Republic Category:Union for French Democracy politicians Category:Women mayors of places in France Category:Senators of Pyrénées-Orientales
title: Jacqueline Alduy
